bill_title: to revise certain provisions regarding the release of health care information.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions regarding the release of health care information. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Except as specifically provided in § § 19-13-9 to 19-13-11, inclusive, and 19-2-3 and 19-2-3.2, no person is required to disclose any health care information about an individual pursuant to a compulsory legal process, including subpoenas, subpoenas duces tecum, and other discovery requests, in any judicial, legislative, or administrative proceeding unless: (1) The individual has consented in writing to the release of the information in response to the compulsory process; or (2) A certified court order is provided. Section 2. Any person, releasing health care information in good faith pursuant to the provisions of section 1 of this Act, is not liable for any injury or damage proximately resulting from the release of the information. Section 3. That § 19-13-8 be amended to read as follows: 19-13-8. The privilege described by § 19-13-7 may be claimed by the patient, his the patient's guardian or conservator, or the personal representative or surviving spouse of a deceased patient. The person who was the physician or psychotherapist at the time of the communication is presumed to have authority to claim the privilege but only on behalf of the patient.
